places.name: Triveni Sangam
places.description: The confluence of three holy rivers - Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati. It's a sacred spot for Hindu pilgrims.

places.name: Allahabad Fort
places.description: A historic fort built by Emperor Akbar in 1583 AD. It houses several ancient monuments and temples.

places.name: Shri Bade Hanuman Ji Mandir
places.description: A famous temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman, known for its large idol of Hanuman and its religious significance.

places.name: Chandrashekhar Azad Park
places.description: Chandra Shekhar Azad Park is a public park in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, India. Built in 1870 to mark Prince Alfred's visit to the city, with an area of 133 acres, it is the biggest park in Prayagraj.

places.name: Allahabad University
places.description: One of the oldest universities in India, known for its rich academic heritage and beautiful campus.

places.name: Anand Bhavan
places.description: The ancestral home of the Nehru-Gandhi family, now converted into a museum showcasing the life of Jawaharlal Nehru and the Indian independence movement.

places.name: Khusro Bagh
places.description: A Mughal garden housing the tombs of Prince Khusrau, daughter Sultan Begum, and Shah Begum. It's known for its beautiful architecture and serene ambiance.

places.name: All Saints Cathedral
places.description: A majestic Anglican cathedral built during the British colonial era. It's known for its stunning architecture and serene atmosphere.

places.name: Allahabad Museum
places.description: A museum showcasing a vast collection of artifacts, sculptures, and manuscripts reflecting the rich cultural heritage of Prayagraj.

places.name: Swaraj Bhawan
places.description: A historic building where the first Prime Minister of India, Jawaharlal Nehru, was born. It played a significant role in the Indian freedom struggle.

places.name: Jawahar Planetarium
places.description: A space-themed educational center offering fascinating exhibits, interactive sessions, and celestial shows about astronomy and space exploration.
